attributes.action: Allow fully reopen all hospitality establishments when non-essential shops do.
attributes.additional_details: Government has not provided aligned support with restrictions to the industry. This has put in danger many small businesses and after a year using hospitality as a scapegoat is time to put an end to this unless hard, scientific evidence is provided along with sufficient funds to allow businesses to survive.
attributes.background: There is no hard evidence that hospitality causing COVID-19 to spread more or faster. If non-essential shops are safe to open with people brushing shoulders in aisles then a sit-down meal with mask while waiting and safe distance kept between tables is logically not an issue either.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

Under the Government's roadmap out of lockdown, non-essential retail will reopen and hospitality venues will be allowed to serve people outdoors at Stage 2 (no earlier than 12th April). See:
https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/covid-19-response-spring-2021/covid-19-response-spring-2021-summary

If there are changes you'd like to see to the roadmap, such as bringing forward the reopening of indoor hospitality from Stage 3 to Stage 2, you could start a new petition calling for those changes.

You might also like to sign the following petition:

Provide additional support to pubs, restaurants and all hospitality sectors.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552314
